casebody.data:
HERRELL
v.
RINI 2018-1191 Supreme Court of Ohio. February 13, 2019

CASE ANNOUNCEMENTS

MERIT DECISIONS WITHOUT OPINIONS

In Prohibition. On respondents' motion for judgment on the pleadings. Motion denied. Sua sponte, alternative writ granted. The following briefing schedule is set for presentation of evidence and filing of briefs pursuant to S.Ct.Prac.R. 12.05: The parties shall file any evidence they intend to present within seven days, relator shall file a brief within five days after the filing of the evidence, respondents shall file a brief within seven days after the filing of relator's brief, and relator may file a reply brief within three days after the filing of respondents' brief. O'Connor, C.J., and Kennedy, French, Fischer, Donnelly, and Stewart, JJ., concur. DeWine, J., dissents.
